name: Cave Game (Daniel D'Onofrio)
description:
A short 15 minute game made as a student project in  6 weeks.  Featuring exploration, puzzles, and secrets!

NOTE: being my first game, I didn't know how to do a lot of things. This means:

- There is no sound what so ever.

- Functionality is bare-bones. I apologise for the player control system; its the default unity one. In addition, it was intended for you to have a gravity gun esque device to manipulate the environment with.  That isn't here, but you can still pick up and move things, and shoot buttons at a distance, as if you had it.

- There is a distinct point where the art budget ran out, so to speak. We were given 4 weeks to design and build the 'grey box' of the level, and 2 weeks to art it up. 

- There are no menus in the game. To exit, you must Alt+F4 it.

If these don't put you off, feel free to give it a try. I have upload it here mainly so it exists in a public space, where I can point people to it if they ask.
